title: 1a
description:
Regenerator:

Rather than introduce expensive fresh catalyst to the process, the existing coke covered spent catalyst coming from the reactor can be regenerated by removing the coke deposits using high temperature air at around 600 - 700 C.

title: 1b
description:
Reactor:

Feed is heated and mixed with the catalyst; reaction starts even before the fluid reaches the reactor;

Therefore, the residence time in the reactor vessel is very short.

The prime role of the reactor is to function as a catalyst separator removing spent (coked) catalyst and direct it to the regenerator with cracked products moving on to the fractionator.

Fractionator:

The fractionating column separates the light ends, gasoline, and fuel oils.

The remaining bottoms product is termed cycle oil and is typically fed back to the beginning of the process where it is mixed with the fresh feed.
